Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2013 10:18AM karenmcardle wrote: I am waiting for them to call me back right now.  They did move it up a week, but because of my distress the receptionist is trying to move it up even more.  I have 2 red lesions at this point as well as what looks like bruising going from them toward the nipple.  The  nipple has an indent when I raise my arm.  Breast feels itchy and burny. I may check my insurance page and see if I can find another breast surgeon in the area that is available. Thank you both, I'm just very scared right now.  Inflammatory breast cancer keeps banging around in my head.  You couple that with intense bone pain for the last 5 months that they can't decide what is from and I'm going from bad to worse in my head.
Posts.Title: Should I insist that my breast surgeon appt be moved up? karenmcardle EmD

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2013 03:07PM karenmcardle wrote: My gyno just called and insisted I be seen sooner.  I go Wednesday at 12:15 to talk to the breast surgeon. Fingers crossed and hands folded.  Karen (who is also getting a call from the endocrin surgeon today...life's a ride!)
Posts.Title: Should I insist that my breast surgeon appt be moved up? karenmcardle EmD

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2013 08:10AM karenmcardle wrote: I have had 3 aunts with Breast Cancer...a mother who had it 10 years ago and goes in the 14th of January (2013) for double mastectomy as she has stage 1 encapsulated again in the left breast and stage two invasive in the right. She will be taking the test.  If she has BR CA (new to this so if I get the terms incorrect...please understand) then my sisters and I will go for the counseling and test and all have decided if we have the gene we will have mastectomies as well. I wish you much good luck, and I'll peek in to see how you are doing.
